alert.note: Alert for Elbert, Central and East Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet; North Douglas County Below 6000 Feet, Denver, West Adams and Arapahoe Counties, East Broomfield County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 30 at 11:26AM MST until January 30 at 8:00PM MST by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM MST THIS EVENING... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 9 PM THIS EVENING TO 8 AM MST TUESDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory today, bands of moderate to heavy snow are expected to develop. Snowfall rates of 1 to 2 inches per hour may occur this afternoon and early this evening, with total snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches possible. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected tonight. Wind chills as low as 20 below zero. * WHERE...Denver, and Castle Rock. Interstate 70 from Denver west towards the foothills and Interstate 25 from Denver south to Castle Rock will likely be impacted by the heavier bands of snow. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 8 PM MST this evening. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from 9 PM this evening to 8 AM MST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the Monday evening and Tuesday morning commutes. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for Colorado can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or by going to www.cotrip.org. The combination of wind and cold temperatures will create dangerously low wind chill values. If you go outside, cover all parts of your body, especially your head, face, and hands.
